rComments: A complete joke of a prof with absolutely no ability to teach anyone how to play or listen. She's the type of prof who makes you want to hate music and the type of person who makes the business of music the mess that it is today. A totally deaf, hypercritical witch. I hated every class she "taught" - which translates to insulting everyone in sight.
If you have ability, know how to listen, and don't study with her teacher, expect to be the target of her projections, psychological warfare, and absurd jealously. Good riddance!

She's the best of the profs on the faculty for insulting. useless comments and bad teaching. Good luck reasoning with this creature. She doesn't respect you and needs serious amounts of therapy - or perhaps a boyfriend, if one could stand to be around her.
Comments are condescending and discouraging and not at all with good intentions to teach. Has few favourite students of her own and plays unfairly to other students in the program.

Lightweight professor with such a poor approach. It's amazing she is even teaching at UofT.  After leaving school, haven't run into anyone who can say they know her that well, and those who do, don't respect her as a pianist, musician, or teacher. Her teaching is a joke, and a sardonic one, she truly causes you to hate everything you play.

Lydia is not only a wonderful prof but an incredible human being. Obviously has tremendous life+career experience that shows in her teaching and her interactions with me. She was able to not only address my technical issues at the piano but push for my musical growth. Extremely caring in my personal struggles and devoted time to help me through it.
Of course you have to earn her respect. But once you have it, you're in the clear! Hilarious, approachable and helpful.

Oh, give me a break. She's great and funny! You must be interested in what she has to say, and take what she says to heart if you want to a)improve, and b)earn her respect. Being technically proficient is a given...hard to find at this school..

Extremely biased in her judgment of students, she gives you feedback not on how well you play, but based on how much she likes/dislikes you.  I've seen and heard about her tearing apart students in front of all their peers.  She apparently has no problem with making students cry in front of the whole class while she continues on her verbal rampage
